title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest adopted No. 55 at USC, a tradition started by Junior Seau, and maintained it in the NFL.
McGinest wore No. 55 with the New England Patriots from 1994-2005, leading to three Super Bowl wins.
Junior Seau and Brandon Spikes continued the No. 55 legacy, which holds historical significance for the Patriots.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County received the highest snow totals, with 13 inches recorded in Salisbury and Beverly during the February 7 storm.
Bristol County saw heavy snowfall, including 8.2 inches in Dartmouth and 6.5 inches in Rehoboth, as reported by amateur radio.
Middlesex County experienced moderate snow, with top amounts reaching 7 inches near Marlborough and 6.2 inches in Winchester.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico to call his first Super Bowl for NBC, featuring the Patriots vs. Seahawks in Santa Clara, California.
Tirico will also host NBC's Olympic studio program 'Primetime in Milan' following the Super Bowl broadcast.
Tirico emphasizes the importance of preparation and excitement for covering both the Super Bowl and the Olympics.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs against the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California.
Patriots' quarterback Drake Maye could become the youngest winner if they triumph; he's the second-youngest to start a Super Bowl.
Seattle's sixth-best defense contrasts with New England's second-best scoring offense, highlighting a key matchup in Super Bowl LX.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' Mike Vrabel consulted with Bill Belichick and Andy Reid ahead of coaching his first Super Bowl.
Vrabel has utilized offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels's experience, preparing for the Patriots' Super Bowl LX matchup.
Vrabel led Patriots to 14 wins in his first season, winning Coach of the Year before Super Bowl LX.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The New England Patriots aim to secure their seventh Super Bowl win, surpassing Pittsburgh for most franchise victories.
Mike Vrabel could become the first person to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both player and coach.
A Patriots victory would mark the first time a team won the Super Bowl after a previous 4-13 season.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs seeks Super Bowl win with Patriots to boost Hall of Fame prospects.
Diggs has been named to four Pro Bowls and earned two All-Pro honors in his career.
Diggs ranks 38th in receiving yards with 11,504 and 43rd in receiving touchdowns with 73.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, ex-Patriots and Colts kicker, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots, including key field goals in Super Bowl XXXVI and XXXVIII.
With 2,673 career points, Vinatieri holds the NFL record for most points and 44 consecutive field goals made.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel simulated a long halftime break for the Patriots' practice to prepare for Super Bowl conditions.
Stefon Diggs avoided confirming rumors of Cardi B joining Bad Bunny for the Super Bowl halftime show.
Drake Maye was a full participant in practice, while Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Super Bowl LX features quarterbacks Drake Maye of the Patriots and Sam Darnold of the Seahawks facing off.
The Patriots' success depends on minimizing Drake Maye's turnovers against the Seahawks' strong defense.
Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba poses a significant threat, leading in receiving yards and touchdowns this season.
